name: ocean
title: An international flight
statement1: You are going on a trip to another country. During the flight, you look out the window and realize you've never been so far above the ocean. You feel thrilled.
question: Is it exhilarating to be so high up?

name: tutor
title: Feedback from your tutor
statement1: You finish a task due next week for your evening class and ask the tutor for their opinion. They say the work is good, apart from an incomplete section. You feel that they think you are learning.
question: Your tutor probably thinks
positive: You are making progress in the subject.
negative: You are lazy because you did not complete the whole task.

name: cardio
title: Cardio class
statement1: It's Wednesday night and your friend convinces you to take a high-intensity cardio class. About halfway through you stop exercising, because you feel you can't catch your breath. As you begin to have anxious thoughts about passing out, you decide to simply notice them.
question: When feeling like you can't catch your breath, it is helpful to
positive: Just observe your anxious thoughts and sensations without judgment.
negative: Judge your breathlessness as bad or harmful.

name: rough
title: Mistakes on the job
statement1: Even though you normally excel at your job, you recently had a rough week at work. Specifically, you made a couple of mistakes on an important project. When you think about the future, you think it is likely that your job is secure.
question: In the upcoming weeks at work, you will probably

name: neighbor
title: Spotting a neighbor
statement1: As you are walking down a crowded street, you see your neighbor on the other side. You call out, but they do not answer you. Standing there in the street, you think that this must be because they were distracted.
question: Did your neighbor purposely ignore your call to them in the street?

name: sleep
title: Time to sleep
statement1: You are lying in your bed, about to go to sleep. As everything quiets down, you begin to breathe slower than you usually do. This is relaxing.
question: The slowing of your heart rate and breathing probably means
positive: Your body needs rest after a long day of work.
negative: You are not getting enough oxygen and will pass out.
